Key Match Events: Chasing 183 runs in the third T20I against India at Harare, Zimbabwe could only score 159/6 runs in 20 overs and lost to India by 23 runs.
Indian skipper Shubman Gill scored 66 runs in just 36 deliveries, achieving his fifth T20I half-century.
Ruturaj Gaikwad scored 49 off 28 deliveries and missed his half-century by just one run.
Washington Sundar picked up three wickets for India, while Avesh Khan and Khaleel Ahmed took two and one wicket respectively.
Dion Myers scored a half-century of 45 balls and was unbeaten at 65 off 49 balls for Zimbabwe.
Clive Madande scored 37 off 26 balls for Zimbabwe.
Pre-Game Insights: India won the toss and decided to bat first.
Yashasvi Jaiswal opened the innings for India.
Shubman Gill expressed confidence in the team's chances with the addition of World Cup winners Yashasvi Jaiswal, Sanju Samson, and Sanju Samson.
Zimbabwe's skipper Sikandar Raza acknowledged the need for the senior players to step up after a 100-run defeat in the last encounter.
Post-Match Reflections: India skipper Shubman Gill said, 'Definitely it feels very good, it was a crucial game for us, the way we started with the bat and ball was good.'
Zimbabwe's skipper Sikandar Raza said, 'I think it's the fielding again, we are proud of our fielding but the wheels came off today, we gave away 20 extra runs and we lost by 23 runs.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain delays led to the game being postponed until the next day.
